column5: heading up in a couple of weeks.. don't want to drag up a lot of food will buy in canada any good stores.. any place to get a good piece of meat. thanks alot JAKE any good bait shops in dryden ???????????

The Co-op store in Vermilion Bay has its own butcher and excellent meat. Darcy or the other butcher will cut whatever you need. All the other stores in Dryden have there meat shipped in already cut and packaged.

[font color=green size=3][b]If you go to the COOP store make sure you have Canadian $. The last time I was there, they wouldn't take a USA credit card or a check on the local Canadian bank, because the manager didn't "know" me. So I used US $ and they really scorched me on the exchange rate. Come to think of it that's why I haven't gone back. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby
hit a moose on 502... fresh and free!!!

They take visa and mastercard. Exchange rates are never the best at local businesses...afterall, they are not a bank. Do some planning in advance and bring some CDN $ or just use a card. Still have great meat and service from the butchers, which is hard to beat.
